column11: Review Text
Best place for recreation. Amazing and peaceful surrounding. Safe for bath and locals are very helpful. Tickets. For Locals - 50Lkr per person For foreigners - 300 Lkr per person.

column8: Great local out of the way swimming spot
column11: A great little spot for a dip. Get yourself a Tuk Tuk or two and whizz down here for some R&R! Not at all touristy or commercial and well lived by locals who may stare a bit but are very welcoming. Beautiful waterfall and swimming venue

Bopath ella is a most beautiful and famous water fall in Sri lanka. It is located in Kuruwita area of Rathnapura District.It has a shape very similar to the leaf of the sacred "BO" tree which has earned it this name.The water of Bopath falls flows into the Kaluganga river.Many tourists visit this waterfall.

It is one of the most beautiful waterfalls in the rathnpur district.the place is easily aaccessible.it is also a place rich in natural diversity.it is a great place to spend some free time,and it s a great place to visit ...ðŸŒ¿ðŸŒ¿ðŸŒ±ðŸŒ±

column8: Bopath Ella is a very nice place
column11: It is very nice place .and cool .i travel there more than seven time.it's better to visit there evening or morning . Bute evening times some dangerous .

This is a very nice and cool waterfall.good place to visit if you are looking for adventure.you can have a bath also if you need.Some were drunk. It was a hindrance to our freedom. But the coolness of the waterfall made us mentally healthy.some times the fall may get rough due to the rain in upper areas.take care.

column8: One of the very famous waterfalls in Sri Lanka
column11: This is a very nice and very famous waterfall & 30m tall. This is in Kuruwita, 2.5hrs (around 75km) away from Colombo, from Kuruwita turn to Higgashena - Devipahala rd. Location is there in the google map and can easily follow that. Vehicles have to park at the car park and walk up to the waterfall view point. If someone wants to go to the bottom of the waterfall have to cross the water stream and find your way through the rocks. Not hard but get the advice from the ticketing counter before you cross the do that.  During the rainy season water levels can go up and rocks can be slippery. Time you spend here is subjected to what you want do here, just seeing the fall from the view point, want to go closer to the fall, taking professional pics, having a bath or having a picnic.......  There are so many food stalls and hotels nearby ... But due to corvid, now many have closed down.

Hi, Its located between Colombo  & Rathnapura (Gem city) and its take near 3 hours direct driving Colombo airport with 88 Km distance. The way of the place in very green and comfortable. Nice waterfall located their with nice river and its need to educated area guide with the first time visitors. This the additional activity for the road travelling Colombo to Bandarawela crossing Rathnapura City. Thanks.
Everyone must go there Lovely and calm place surrounded with lovely nature You can bring your bags and other stuff Peoples are drinking sometimes so better to care yourself

nice experience. good place to visit if u are looking for adventure. have to walk through a stream with very slippery rocks to go near the waterfall.not advisable to take small kids.can bathe in the stream with shallow water.can go on a small bamboo raft for Rs.250 for a short distance just for the experience of it.but overpriced.
To go closer to the waterfall, one needs to take a boat trip to cross to the other bank. The water is not bit yellow this time. There are rocks to climb and it is quite enjoyable.

If you are passing Kuruwita, Bopath Falls is not a sight to miss. A gift from the mother nature, Bopath falls is popular among travelers because of the natural pool. Situated around 7km away from the main road.

A very popular place for locals and a dramatic Waterfall. You need to wade through a river and clamber over rocks to get a good view of the waterfall. The locals are very helpful and warn you when you are nearing dangerous areas. Worth a visit but probably too tricky with young children
Niz plc to visit..u hv to cross d river to reach waterfall..also u can swim near the waterfall or river...

An awesome waterfall located near colombo. 1.5hrs drive through avissawella road. Near waterfall have to drive through off road and small roads. Bike is suitable than cars. 20rs ticket for locals 100 for foreigner. You should navigate ur way to up then u can have a calm natural pool all by urself. Not much crowded.
The falls are beautiful. But what puts you off is the Large sign boards. It says Entry for foreign guests Rs 100/- and Locals Rs 20/- . Why ? Is this not Natures Gift to us

It wasn't difficult to reach this place. We visited there from a private vehicle. There is a entry ticket which you'll have to pay at the gate. Cost about 100rs for a foreigner. For a local adult its 20rs. Try to visit the fall by going little bit closer to it. Worth the visit. You can have a bath also if you need.

The waterfall itself is high up and far away but some of the cool water cascades to a very large bathing area. It is very safe and calm during the dry season but there is a lot of water during the rainy seasonand it can get very dangerous for bathing. Tickets are issued to enter. Vehicles cannot be taken in. If you have lunch at a hotel down the single lane narrow approach road, you can use their car park.
This is the closest large scale waterfall to Colombo.A famous place among locals and foreigners too. But the place got dirty by the travelers.
A gift from mother nature that polluted by human being. Some times the fall may get rough due to the rain in upper areas. Take care when you go to the center.

really beutiful falls - two ways to access - through the forest - easier route, through the rocks - difficult route. but the views at the end are simply stunning. caution - slippery, flash floods possible
Very beautiful and attractive place.  But travelers  have to pay more attention about dumping garbage. we have to keep this beautiful place clean.

Bopath fall is near by kuruvita town on the way to Rathnapura from colombo, Sri lanka 4 km away from the A4 main road(near by Rathnapura). This area is wet and hot in nature. Lot of wet zone trees and fish verities can be seen around the falls. most of the time local visitors love to come and visit the fall, but sudden increase in water level can be a dangerous situation. Lovely place for nature lovers.
its very wonderfull palce,we can enjoy our self,locate wonderfull area.water is very cooll,place in kuruwita,road very good
Nice place be relaxed. When you guys go there pls remember not to polute the environment. Alwauys remember to bring back everything that do not belog to the Nature.
Fine location for a little fun. The area not very nice to be at if the place is crowded. Ideal time to visit would be the early morning hours.

This waterfall has been highlighted since it is one of the few attractive waterfalls location within a shorted distance from Colombo. Even though Sri Lanka is a country of having many nice waterfalls, most of those are located in hill country which we will have to spend more time when travelling from Colombo. You have to drive from Colombo - Rathnapura main road and have to turn left near Kuruwita. There is a name board at the road where you have to get that turn. The hight of this waterfall is only 30 m. But it has a nice view. The name "Bopath Ella" has derived from it's shape. The shape of it looks like a "Boo Leaf" (a leaf of Ficus religiosa) when the waterfall is rich with water during the rainy season. Even though some people used to have a bath at the nearby pond, it is very dangerous to bath at the areas closer to the waterfall because there is a risk of increasing the water level rapidly mostly during rainy seasons. Please be careful when getting into the rocks since most of those are very slippery and the pools surrounded by those rocks closer to the waterfall are very deep.

Beautiful place and you may visit in mid rainy days .More rains will ruins the beauty .Rocks are bit slippery and be careful .Some times the water level is increasing in the afternoon ,so be careful and watchful .Please bath where place seems appropriate.Walk away distance is around 0.5Kn from car parking . Bad toilet facilities and bad water facilities .

I visited Bopath ella with a group of friends, (all of us 55+ seniors!). It was around 1 p.m. and the hike up to the falls was too much of an effort, but we were very keen to get a good view of the falls. The only option was to go to the nearby restaurant which was facing the waterfall. We were tired after a long drive, and since we wanted a good view of the waterfall we decided to go to the restaurant instead of walking in the hot sun towards the water. The attendant at the parking area came with us. The place was deserted, there were used glasses and tea cups lying about. The attendant said there was neither food nor cool drinks available, only tea. After climbing to the top level which gave us a fantastic view of the waterfall, we were served sweetened tea by the same attendant, in spite of informing him that none of us took sugar in our tea. There were mops and cleaning equipment lying in the corridors. The 'Manager' appeared much later as we wanted to settle the bill. The place was thoroughly disorganised. However, I should mention that the hotel garden was beautiful and well maintained, in spite of the poor service we received. To give the benefit of the doubt, perhaps they had not quite got round to their normal routine after the Sinhalese New year holidays - the time of year when everything comes to a grinding halt in Sri Lanka. Along the way to our destination  we saw heaps of rubbish dumped by the roadside in polythene bags. Stray dogs and crows were having a field day. The negligence of the surrounding area and the environment was appalling. Nature is very resilient. Sri Lanka is a beautiful country blessed with such fantastic scenery and natural resources. Humans including visitors, locals, vendors and the hotel owners spoil it. There is much room for improvement around this beautiful waterfall which I would have rated 'Excellent' by itself, if not for the human factor.

Our family went this trip to have some fun and to have a good fresh bath. The trip was so enjoyable. The shape of the ella was just like a leaf of the sacred Bo-Tree. the Village is located on a village name Agalwatta.
I visited here while travelling to Badulla and just had a awesome time. No much water on the waterfall. But cool place to visit and enjoy.
The fall itself is very beautiful but a lot of rubbish and garbage is laying around. Going close to the falls can be slippery
The place is absolutely amazing, I loved a bath in there But I felt intimidated by locals, they don't make us feel comfortable
Good Place , but you should be more & more careful. the rocks are slippery. I totally disagree why the Local Authority Collect money from the tourist. the wash room facilities are very very poor.

It's a amazing sight. Even when no rain in the area suddenly water levels of the falls gets higher due to rains in over lands. It was near Adams peak mountain. So when mountain gets rain it flow down to nearby lower lands. Also lots of locals visiting and keep your distance from them.
The place is nicely done by the authorities and has become a convenient and safe place even to visit and have a bath and a nice time with kids

Last year we have visited to bopath ella inKuruwita. From colombo to Kuruwita it is about one and half hour journey. We hired a van from my friend for 9000rupees. Driver was a friendly guy. With four of my friends we enjoyed pure water came from bopath ella. It was nice experience. Some one told us that it is dangerous some places in Bopath ella. There are nice rocks that you can get attractive photographs Recommend for everyone

A place not to miss when in Kuruwita or travelling to Ratnapura. Best time to visit will be in the morning when locals will have less access and great for family, friends and team outings. Decent hotels and restaurants are available close by. Access from main highway will be tuk tuks and very limited public transportation, so watch out. Great view is guaranteed!
you can have a oar ride as well if negotiate with those people.However people bring liquor and do a mess in this beautiful place.Be careful as water levels can be suddenly go up.

Bopath ella in kuruwita is a nice creation of mother nature which is 80km away from colombo. It takes around 3 hours to get there. Its a big a very nice waterfall which is a must see if anyone is going through ratnapura or kuruwita. The fall get this 'Bopath ella' name because the waterfall itself has the shape of a Bo leave. i highly recommend this waterfall for nature lovers. â˜º
The waterfall was beautifully magnificent! Its a wonder!! You have to Pay LKR 100 to enter but its fully worth it. A hike to the top of the waterfall and a dip in the river would make your day!
lovely cascade of water starting from a small stream and ending up in large cascades, easy access to the falls
